contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox river |name = Yuryuzan River |image_name = Ust-Katav, Russia - 1.JPG |caption = Yuryuzan river near [[Ust-Katav]] in [[Chelyabinsk Oblast]]. |origin = [[Yamantaw]], [[Urals|South Urals]]<br>{{coord|54|17|39|N|58|14|28|E|format=dms|display=inline}} |mouth = [[Pavlovskoye Dam]]<br>{{coord|55|42|20|N|56|58|15|E|format=dms|display=inline,title}} |basin_countries = [[Russia]] |length = 404 km |elevation_m = 960 |mouth_elevation_m = 140 |discharge = 55 m³/s |watershed = 7,240 km² }} '''Yuryuzan River''' ({{Lang-ru|Юрюза́нь}}, ''Yuryuzán''; {{Lang-ba|Йүрүҙән}}, ''Yürüðän'') is a [[river]] in the [[Bashkortostan|Republic of Bashkortostan]] and [[Chelyabinsk Oblast]] in [[Russia]], a left [[tributary]] of the [[Ufa River]] ([[Kama River|Kama]] [[drainage basin|basin]]). The length of the river is {{convert|404|km|mi|sp=us}}. The area of its basin is {{convert|7240|km2|sqmi|sp=us}}. The Yuryuzan River flows into the [[Pavlovskoye Reservoir]] near [[Karaidel]]. It freezes up in the second half of October – early December and stays under the ice until April. The river is navigable within the first {{convert|16|km|mi|sp=us}} of its [[estuary]]. The towns of [[Yuryuzan (town)|Yuryuzan]] and [[Ust-Katav]] are located on the Yuryuzan River. The Yuryuzan River is very popular river for easy rafting. The name of the river originates from the [[Bashkir language]] and means "The big river". {{Commons category-inline|Yuryuzan River|'''Yuryuzan River'''}} [[Category:Rivers of Chelyabinsk Oblast]] [[Category:Rivers of Bashkortostan]] {{Bashkortostan-geo-stub}} {{ChelyabinskOblast-geo-stub}}
